Element.description: a connector that connects to a note shape for attaching additional description of the connected model element
contains subrequirements/child requirements in terms of a requirements hierarchy
condition under which a behavior will be executed
a relationship that represents a 'part-of' relationship between the source and target elements
a relationship between two model elements where changes in one of them will similarly affect the other
a text area to put in remarks
further describes a requirement through a model element or set of elements
a relationship between a requirement and any other model element
a system/application function to be satisfied
relates a derived requirement to its source requirement
acts as a reference to an existing model element in the project (e.g. represents the source element of a satisfy relationship)
describes how a design or implementation model satisfies one or more requirements
a dependency to specify that the text of a client requirement is a read-only copy of the text of a supplier requirement
a method for verifying that a requirement is met
a dependency between a requirement and a test case/other model element that can ensure a system fulfills the requirement
